Simpson Pushes Nuclear Energy, Yucca Mountain with Energy Secretary

April 1, 2009 | Posted in Press Releases

Idaho Congressman Mike Simpson, in a meeting with Energy Secretary Steven Chu yesterday, stressed the importance of nuclear energy to our nation’s economic growth and pushed for more information on an alternative plan to Yucca Mountain. Simpson Cosponsors the Meth Mouth Prevention and Community Recovery Act

March 30, 2009 | Posted in Press Releases

The methamphetamine epidemic has led to a growing need for costly dental care. Idaho Congressman Mike Simpson joined House colleagues in introducing bi-partisan legislation, H.R. 1671, the Meth Mouth Prevention and Community Recovery Act, that will aid providers in combating this pandemic. Simpson's Bill to Rename Birds of Prey to Honor Morley Neslon and the Auger Falls Lands Bill Included in Omnibus Lands Bill

March 26, 2009 | Posted in Press Releases

When the House of Representatives passed the Omnibus Public Lands Management Act of 2009, Congressman Mike Simpson’s bill to rename the Morley Nelson Snake River Birds of Prey National Conservation Area was included. Bill Providing Better Wildfire Management Passes House

March 26, 2009 | Posted in Press Releases

Idaho Congressman Mike Simpson today voted in favor of H.R. 1404, the Federal Land Assistance, Management, and Enhancement Act (FLAME Act). Simpson, who is Ranking Member of the House Interior and Resources Appropriations Subcommittee, is an original cosponsor to the legislation that boosts funding for catastrophic wildfires. Simpson, Nuclear Cleanup Caucus Request EM Funding to be Included in Budget

March 24, 2009 | Posted in Press Releases

Idaho Congressman Mike Simpson joined fellow members of the House Nuclear Cleanup Caucus in sending letters to Secretary of Energy Steven Chu and to House Budget Committee Chairman John Spratt and Ranking Member Paul Ryan requesting that funding for the Environmental Management (EM) Program be included in their FY10 Budget request. AIG Bonuses Need To Be Called Back

March 19, 2009 | Posted in Press Releases

Idaho Congressman Mike Simpson shares the widespread public outrage about the bonuses AIG issued to its employees and strongly believes that these bonuses need to be paid back to the taxpayer through effective, legal means. The United States House of Representatives designated the United States Postal Service located at 103 W. Main Street in McLain, Mississippi, as the ‘Major Ed W. Simpson Sponsors Legislation for Homeowners Who Have Paid Their Mortgages

March 13, 2009 | Posted in Press Releases
